TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police instituted criminal proceedings against him on suspicion of fraud . Subsequently , additional charges were brought against the applicant ( unlawful acquisition of a vehicle , money laundering and forging documents ) . Since DATE , he has remained in detention on remand .
CARDINAL . Following the completion of the pre - trial investigation , on DATE the case was transferred to LOC , which on DATE delivered a judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Appeal quashed that judgment and remitted the case for fresh examination to ORG , before which the proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , in the course of the proceedings CARDINAL witnesses and QUANTITY victims were interrogated , questioned or confronted , some of them repeatedly . This took the authorities DATE in total . CARDINAL forensic examinations were ordered and lasted for DATE in total . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned due to the applicant ’s and CARDINAL other co - defendants’ representatives’ , GPE and witnesses’ failure to appear . The applicant disagreed stating that his representative had not been informed of the hearings which he had not attended . CARDINAL hearing was adjourned on the applicant ’s request . CARDINAL further hearings were adjourned , mainly because the defendants were not escorted to the court , due to the ORG or prosecutor ’s failure to appear or because the judge was absent . On several occasions the courts issued compulsory summonses for witnesses .
